intro: Vilfa × lutosa, commonly known as the hybrid between vilfa and lutosa, is a naturally occurring hybrid in the Apiaceae family. It typically exhibits characteristics of both parent species, with a tall, erect growth habit and compound umbels of small white or greenish-white flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal practices. Due to its hybrid nature, Vilfa × lutosa can display genetic variability in morphology and chemical composition.
